title: Phillies' Schwarber 1st in NL to reach 50 homers

title: Poch defends U.S. players: 'Criticize me,' not them

content: Astros pitcher Luis Garcia, making his second start after sitting out more than two years while recovering from Tommy John surgery, exited because of right elbow discomfort.

content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day is not a fan of proposed changes to the NCAA transfer portal, saying the potential move to a single transfer window in January "doesn't make any sense."

title: Emergency cell set up at A.P. Bhavan in Delhi to assist Telugus stranded in Nepal
content: Suresh Babu has been designated as the Emergency Nodal Officer at AP Bhavan and may be contacted at +91 9818395787 for assistance

title: Police register three cases against protesters in Maddur
content: Cases have been registered against five persons for alleged pelting of stones at a place of worship, while another case was against an unspecified number of persons involved in tearing the buntings and flags in a locality. The third case is against a woman for hurling abuses against a religious community.

title: Kerala government hands over ‚Çπ17 lakh to nurse infected with Nipah encephalitis
content: The money allocated from the Chief Minister‚Äôs Distress Relief Fund was given to T.C. Thomas and Eliyamma, his parents, by Thottathil Raveendran, MLA.

title: Kozhikode, Malappuram see surge in mule accounts
content: The CBI has identified 8.5 lakh mule accounts in the country, while the Cyber Crime Coordination Centre estimates that the numbers could be over 20 lakh

content: A report prepared by the agency on the directive of the National Green Tribunal has recommended the setting up of evacuation routes, beach nourishment, and spatial planning to minimise the impact of potential disasters caused by the phenomenon, locally known as ‚ÄòKallakadal‚Äô (‚Äòrogue sea‚Äô)

content: As the first State-level urban commission in the country, the Kerala Urban Policy Commission‚Äôs report promises nothing less than a data revolution, governance recalibration, identity revival, and finance empowerment

title: Invoking City Improvement Trust‚Äôs legacy to oppose renaming of street in Chennai
content: Around 50 residents got together and said that the decision to rename 5th Trust Cross Street goes against the naming convention followed in their area, where Trust Cross Streets numbering 1 to 14 exist. Moreover, they said, the existing name is a silent tribute to the CIT that developed the entire locality

content: In this seventh instalment, the subsidy for the period from April 2025 to July 2025 was given to the beneficiaries

content: The 504-page chargesheet containing elaboration on the incidents leading to self-immolation by the girls was filed before the court of sub-divisional judicial magistrate in Balasore

content: After the videos of the protests where the former president of state run Chanchal College‚Äôs TMCP unit was seen burning photographs of the Nobel laureate went viral, the TMCP leadership on Monday evening suspended him.

title: Lalu Prasad performs pind-daan at Vishnupad temple in Gaya ji
content: Leader of Opposition in Bihar Legislative Assembly Tejashwi Yadav said that his father‚Äôs health was not well despite that he wanted to visit Vishnupad temple to perform ‚Äòpind-daan‚Äô for the salvation of his ancestors‚Äô souls.

title: Assam Cabinet approves SOP under Immigrants Expulsion Act
content: The standard operating procedure is aimed at guiding the District Commissioners and Senior Superintendents of Police to expel illegal immigrants from Assam, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: In a first, Indian Armed Forces‚Äô all-women sailing team to circumnavigate the globe
content: The expedition will include crossing the equator twice and rounding the three Great Capes, i.e. Cape Leeuwin in Australia, Cape Horn in South America and the Cape of Good Hope in South Africa.

title: Bombay High Court rejects Rajan Vichare‚Äôs plea against Naresh Mhaske‚Äôs Lok Sabha victory
content: Bombay High Court dismissed Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Rajan Vichare‚Äôs plea challenging Naresh Mhaske‚Äôs 2024 Lok Sabha victory, ruling that his election affidavit was valid and that disclosure of conviction was unnecessary as Mhaske faced no imprisonment. ¬†

title: KMRL to pause piling work; KWA to relocate pipes to solve frequent pipe bursts
content: The decision comes in the wake of frequent pipe bursts in the region and water supply pipes going dry in Thrikkakara municipality.

title: Union government seeks ‚Äòfactual report‚Äô on forest rights complaint concerning Nicobar project
content: Tribal Affairs Ministry has written to the Chief Secretary of Andaman and Nicobar Islands seeking report on a complaint that the administration falsely certified completing identification and settlement of forest rights

title: Hubbub around Habba
content: The Congress government‚Äôs decision to invite Booker winner Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate Mysuru Dasara has the BJP up in arms, calling it ‚Äòappeasement politics‚Äô

title: Hooda demands special flood relief package for Haryana from Centre
content: Former Haryana Chief Minister says the compensation being given is inadequate, and it should be ‚Çπ50,000-‚Çπ60,000 per acre as the farmers have suffered huge losses

title: Rajasthan Assembly passes ‚Äòanti-conversion‚Äô Bill with steep penalties
content: It contains the provisions for life imprisonment and fines up to ‚Çπ1 crore; will help in maintaining ‚Äòpeace and harmony‚Äô in the society, says MoS (Home); Cong. boycotts debate, stages a walkout

title: Karnataka set to get investment of ‚Çπ1,000 crore in bioenergy sector as KSBDB inks pact with German agency
content: Karnataka‚Äôs bioenergy sector is set to get a boost with Hamburg Invest, a financial institution of Germany, signing a Letter of Intent with the Karnataka State Bioenergy Development Board to facilitate investment of ‚Çπ1,000 crore in bioenergy-related projects

title: Victory of nationalist ideology, says V-P elect Radhakrishnan
content: The Vice-President-elect said that in a democracy, ‚Äúboth the ruling party and Opposition parties are important‚Äù. ‚ÄúIt is like two sides of the same coin,‚Äù he said

title: Congress top brass holds meeting on Assembly elections in Bihar
content: Though there was no official word on what transpired in the meeting, sources indicated that the leadership discussed strategies to carry forward the momentum generated by the yatra and build a narrative

title: SPCA lacks teeth, needs enforcement powers to rein in errant cops
content: Though it has been constituted under  Section 110 of the Kerala Police Act for examining complaints against police officers of and up to the said rank of Deputy Superintendent of Police, it lacks enforcement measures. Chairman says without such powers, SPCA can only recommend action

title: Former Thiruvananthapuram Collector M. Nandakumar passes away
content: M. Nandakumar was under treatment at a private hospital for the past four months following a brain surgery.

title: State govt. to combat malnutrition among children through Chiguru scheme
content: Minister Hebbalkar launches the scheme for the select districts of Ballari, Bidar, Kalaburagi, Yadgir, Belagavi, Raichur, Chitradurga, Vijayanagara

title: HESCOM asked to explore uninterrupted power supply for 24x7 water supply network
content: This comes in a bid to address the issue of unscheduled load shedding affecting the 24x7 water supply system in Hubballi-Dharwad

title: AIADMK leaders on edge as Sengottaiyan meets Amit Shah and Nirmala Sitharaman in New Delhi
content: Some¬†AIADMK seniors express discomfort with his action.¬†But they are guarded in saying whether disciplinary action will be taken against him

title: Congratulatory messages pour in for Vice-President elect C.P. Radhakrishnan
content: President Droupadi Murmu says, ‚Äúhis decades of rich experience in public life will contribute significantly to the country‚Äôs progress‚Äù; ‚ÄúHis life has always been devoted to serving society and empowering the poor,‚Äù says PM Modi

title: Colourful pageantry marks end of Onam celebrations
content: The floats on display highlight contemporary issues as well as extoll the achievements made by the State

title: Election Commission directs Bihar CEO to accept Aadhaar for SIR
content: The communique from the poll panel also noted that under the Representation of People Act, 1950, Aadhaar is already one of the documents listed for the purpose of establishing the identity of a person

title: INDIA gathers flock for poll, but fails to keep it together during V-P poll
content: NDA gets 13 votes more than its strength in two Houses, suggesting crossvoting; Opposition claims that out of 315 votes it expected, 300 were cast for its candidate, while 15 votes were invalidated

title: Assam doctor asked to explain 21 C-sections in 10 hours
content: Senior gynaecologist Kantheswar Bordoloi said a single caesarean takes 15-25 minutes, depending on the degree of complication

title: Actor Karisma Kapoor‚Äôs children move Delhi HC for share in late father‚Äôs property
content: The plaintiff submits that the purported will allegedly executed by their father ‚Äòis not a legal and valid document, is forged and fabricated and in any event surrounded by suspicious circumstances‚Äô

title: Army Chief stresses the need for technological edge to stay ahead of rivals
content: The goalposts will keep changing. Because it is not only me, it is the adversary that is also enhancing his technology. I need to make sure my technological level is ready to beat its impact

title: C.P. Radhakrishnan: affable organisation man who doesn‚Äôt play political games
content: Untainted by corruption and having remained above petty organisational politics, Mr. Radhakrishnan is seen as someone who can steer the Rajya Sabha with a similar reach across both sides of the aisle.

title: 'Rahul go back': UP minister sits on dharna on highway; demands apology over insult to PM's mother
content: In Raebareli, Uttar Pradesh, tensions flared as BJP workers, led by state minister Dinesh Pratap Singh, attempted to halt Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's convoy during his two-day visit. Minister Singh staged a dharna on a highway, demanding Gandhi apologize for alleged insults directed at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother during a Congress' Vote Adhikar Yatra in Bihar.

title: Battle over Sunjay Kapur's will: HC asks wife Priya to disclose all assets
content: Karisma Kapoor's children have petitioned the Delhi High Court, seeking their rightful share of their late father Sunjay Kapur's substantial Rs 30,000 crore estate. They allege that their stepmother, Priya Kapur, fabricated the will to gain complete control over the assets. The court has issued a notice and requested a detailed list of Sunjay Kapur's assets.

title: Former PM Deuba left bleeding; FM chased and thrashed ‚Äî harrowing visuals from Nepal
content: Nepal faces turmoil as Gen Z protests against government corruption and censorship led to violence, forcing President Ramchandra Paudel and Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli to resign. Protesters vandalized property, attacked leaders, and even set fire to homes, resulting in casualties. The unrest escalated after social media was blocked, transforming Kathmandu into a battlefield and shaking the nation.

title: After Aishwarya Rai, husband Abhishek Bachchan moves to Delhi HC
content: Abhishek Bachchan has petitioned the Delhi High Court, seeking protection against the unauthorized use of his image and likeness. He is requesting the court to restrict websites and platforms from circulating fake videos, including sexually explicit content, and AI-generated material. This action follows a similar plea filed by his wife, Aishwarya Rai, regarding the misuse of her publicity rights.

title: iPhone Air, iPhone 17, Pro & Pro Max launched: India price, features
content: Apple unveiled its 2025 iPhone lineup, featuring the iPhone Air, iPhone 17, and Pro models. All boast 120Hz displays and 48MP Fusion cameras. The iPhone Air stands out as the thinnest model, while Pro versions see the return of aluminum frames. Pre-orders and India pricing were also announced.

title: 'Dangerous precedent for Europe': Zelenskyy slams Russia's drones in Poland
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns that Russian drones entered Polish airspace. He calls it a dangerous escalation for Europe. Poland confirms the airspace breach and is working to neutralize the drones. Zelenskyy urges a strong, joint response from partners. He says sanctions delay increases brutality. Recent peace efforts involving Donald Trump, Vladimir Putin, and Zelenskyy have not yielded an agreement.

title: New low for D Gukesh: Two straight losses and virtually out of Grand Swiss title race
content: D Gukesh, the world champion, faced another setback at the FIDE Grand Swiss, losing to Nikolas Theodorou on Tuesday after a previous defeat. Theodorou, surprised by Gukesh's opening, capitalised on a missed threefold repetition claim by Gukesh. Despite Gukesh's ambition to win with the White pieces, Theodorou secured the victory in 47 moves.

title: Rs 100 fine! Prithvi Shaw penalised for failing to submit reply in molestation case
content: Cricketer Prithvi Shaw faced a token fine of Rs 100 from a Mumbai sessions court for his delayed response in a molestation case filed by social media influencer Sapna Gill. Despite multiple requests and a final warning, Shaw failed to submit his reply to Gill's petition challenging the rejection of her FIR against him.

title: Record price: iPhone 17 series launched; price in India crosses Rs 2 lakh
content: Apple has launched the iPhone 17 series in India. The iPhone 17 Pro Max 2TB costs Rs 2,29,900. The phones come in deep blue, cosmic orange, and silver. The iPhone 17 Pro has a starting price of Rs 134,900. The new phones have better displays and the A19 Pro chip. The camera system includes three 48MP Fusion cameras.

title: Trade deal: Should India be enthralled by Trump‚Äôs outreach?
content: Amidst emerging optimism regarding trade relations between India and the US, experts caution against excessive enthusiasm. Despite conciliatory remarks from President Trump, high tariffs remain, potentially hindering progress. An expert suggests India should formally challenge the tariffs in the US Supreme Court to protect its interests and support American businesses opposing the duties.

title: Only MS Dhoni! The unique Asia Cup feat unmatched by any Indian captain
content: Overall, India have been crowned Asia Cup champions a record eight times ‚Äî the most by any team in the tournament‚Äôs history. The list of Indian captains who have lifted the trophy reflects the country‚Äôs cricketing pedigree: Sunil Gavaskar (1984), Dilip Vengsarkar (1988), Azharuddin (1990, 1995), Dhoni (2010, 2016), and Rohit (2018, 2023).

title: Google tightens AI use: Coders face strict rules; external tools prohibited
content: Google is mandating its software engineers to exclusively use internal AI models for coding, driven by CEO Sundar Pichai's call for AI adoption to maintain competitiveness. Employees are expected to demonstrate AI proficiency, potentially influencing performance reviews and career advancement.

title: Watch: Sweden‚Äôs new health minister collapses; was holding live press briefing
content: Elisabet Lann, Sweden's newly appointed health minister, fainted onstage during a live press conference on Tuesday, her first day in office. The incident, attributed to a blood sugar drop, occurred while she was answering questions alongside the prime minister and another party leader. After receiving assistance, Lann returned to the conference shortly after the incident.

title: Nepal protests: Army enforces nationwide curfew; soldiers guard parliament
content: Following violent Gen Z-led protests marked by vandalism and attacks, the Nepal army has imposed a nationwide curfew. The curfew, effective until September 11, aims to restore peace and security amidst reports of ongoing criminal activities. Essential vehicles are permitted, and the army urges citizens to rely on official information and support efforts to maintain harmony and national integrity.

title: Bananas! Rs 35 lakh spent on fruits by Uttarakhand cricket; BCCI gets HC notice
content: The Uttarakhand High Court has directed the BCCI to respond to petitions concerning alleged financial irregularities within the Cricket Association of Uttarakhand. The court is examining claims of misused government funds intended for tournament organization. Allegations include inflated expenses, such as a significant amount spent on bananas. Petitioners also claim that promised facilities for state players were not provided.

title: Shwetha Menon recalls being Aishwarya Rai‚Äôs roommate during Miss India 1994
content: Actor Shwetha Menon, who was recently appointed as the first woman president of the Association of Malayalam Movie Artistes (AMMA), took a nostalgic trip back to 1994‚Äîthe year India saw Sushmita Sen and Aishwarya Rai bring home the Miss Universe and Miss World crowns. Speaking at an event, Shwetha revealed that she too was a contestant in the same Miss India pageant and shared a room with Aishwarya during the competition.

title: Air quality: Indore tops but lags on PM10 levels; Delhi figured at 32nd position
content: Indore, India's cleanest city, topped the 'Swachh Vayu Survekshan 2025' for air pollution mitigation, despite a slight PM10 increase. Jabalpur and Agra/Surat followed. Amravati, Dewas led in smaller population categories. Union Minister Bhupender Yadav noted PM10 reductions in 103 NCAP cities, with Mumbai achieving a 44% decline. Chennai is the only metro meeting air quality standards.

title: Nepal unrest: Indian airlines suspend flights to Kathmandu
content: IndiGo, SpiceJet, and Air India have cancelled flights to and from Kathmandu due to the extended closure of Tribhuvan International Airport, prompted by security concerns amidst escalating anti-corruption protests. Passengers are offered rescheduling options and refunds. The Indian Ministry of External Affairs advises citizens to defer travel to Nepal and exercise caution due to the ongoing political unrest.

title: 'We found metal shards': Man falls ill after consuming soft drink on SpiceJet flight
content: Abhijit Bhosle, a businessman, experienced a medical emergency on a SpiceJet flight from Goa to Pune after allegedly consuming a soft drink containing metal shards. Bhosle suffered throat irritation and stomach pain, prompting his friends to alert the crew.

title: INSAS rifle stolen from Mumbai sentry: Navy seaman, brother arrested
content: Mumbai Police have apprehended a Navy seaman and his brother from Telangana for the theft of an INSAS rifle and ammunition from Navy Nagar. The incident occurred when an imposter, disguised as a Navy officer, tricked a junior sailor on duty. Police suspect the brother has Naxal links, investigating a potential motive.

title: ‚ÄòNatural partners‚Äô: PM confident on India-US trade talks; Trump reshares Modi's post
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi responded to President Trump's remarks on trade negotiations, affirming India and the US as close friends and natural partners. He expressed confidence that ongoing discussions will unlock the limitless potential of their partnership. Modi anticipates speaking with Trump soon, aiming for a brighter future for both nations as teams work to conclude negotiations swiftly.

title: 'Not even sparing tourists': Indian woman in Nepal cries for help - video
content: An Indian tourist, Upastha Gill, is stranded in Pokhara, Nepal, and has appealed to the Indian embassy for help as GenZ protests turned violent, leading to the resignation of the Prime Minister. Gill reports that the hotel where she was staying was burned down, and she barely escaped with her life.

title: 'For people affected by floods': Harmanpreet dedicates Asia Cup title to India
content: India's men's hockey team clinched a momentous victory at the Hockey Asia Cup 2025, triumphing on home soil after eight years, led by Captain Harmanpreet Singh. The team dedicated their win to those affected by the devastating floods across India. As a result of winning the Asia Cup, India have secured an automatic berth into the World Cup next year.

title: ‚ÄòOil not quite tool of leverage‚Äô: Expert critiques Trump‚Äôs India tariffs
content: In a scathing analysis, geopolitical analyst David Goldwyn called out Donald Trump's flawed understanding of sanctions against India, especially concerning Russian oil imports, deeming it a classic case of hypocrisy. While Trump slapped tariffs on India, he conveniently sidestepped similar actions against China, mistakenly thinking his influence over India was superior.

title: Sunita Williams‚Äô childhood dream: From animals' love to Nasa; conquering spacewalks
content: Sunita Williams, globally recognized for her space missions, initially aspired to be a veterinarian. Inspired by her brother's Naval Academy experience and the movie 'Top Gun,' she joined the US Navy and became a helicopter pilot. Later, NASA selected her as an astronaut.

title: Cab driver caught 'pleasuring himself' in front of girl student in Delhi
content: Delhi Police arrested Lom Shanka, a cab driver, after a female student reported he masturbated while driving in Maurice Nagar; the cab has been seized. In a separate incident near Rajiv Chowk, a woman was harassed by a man who allegedly exposed himself; police have arrested the accused after a video of the incident went viral.

title: VP polls: Rijiju 'thanks' some oppn MPs for voting for NDA pick
content: Kiren Rijiju, the parliamentary affairs minister, acknowledged opposition MPs who supported NDA's CP Radhakrishnan in the vice-presidential elections. Rijiju expressed gratitude towards INDIA bloc MPs who voted with their "conscience." C P Radhakrishnan was elected as the 15th Vice-President of India, securing 452 votes, suggesting cross-voting as parties cannot issue whips in these elections.

title: 'I am still in shock': British Airways passenger claims woman urinated in seat
content: A British Airways passenger on a Boston to London flight endured a horrifying experience when a co-passenger allegedly urinated in her seat and remained there for the entire six-hour journey. The Redditor, who shared photos of the wet seat and the woman's bare feet intruding on others' space, expressed shock and concern for the next passenger.

title: Rape accused flees from custody: Bulandshahr villagers block cops
content: A rape accused, Mohd Afzal, escaped police custody in Bulandshahr after villagers, including gram pradhan Mohd Rouf, allegedly intervened. An FIR has been filed against Rouf and 30 villagers for aiding Afzal's escape. Police are investigating the incident, including claims that villagers blocked roads to hinder the police.

title: Thar destroyed in ‚Äònimbu ritual‚Äô misstep: SUV smashes through showroom's glass wall
content: In a bizarre turn of events in Delhi's Nirman Vihar, a woman celebrating her new Mahindra Thar accidentally accelerated, sending the SUV crashing through a showroom's first-floor window. The ritual, intended for good luck, resulted in the car plummeting 15 feet, causing significant damage. Miraculously, the woman sustained only minor injuries, and authorities are currently investigating the incident.

title: Pig heads with Macron's name found outside mosques in Paris
content: French authorities are investigating after at least nine pigs' heads were discovered outside mosques in Paris and its suburbs, some bearing President Macron's name. The incidents, condemned by political leaders as "outrageous" and "racist acts," occur amid rising religious tensions and a surge in anti-Muslim incidents in France.

title: ‚ÄòPhillies Karen‚Äô identified, fired after taking Bader HR ball from kid
content: During a Phillies vs. Marlins game, Harrison Bader's home run ball was caught by Drew Feltwell, who gifted it to his son Lincoln. A woman demanded the ball, sparking outrage online and earning her the moniker "Phillies Karen." Despite mistaken identity claims involving Leslie-Ann Kravitz and Cheryl Richardson-Wagner, the woman's true identity remains unconfirmed.

title: Gold price prediction: Will rates cross Rs 1.12 lakh mark on MCX future?
content: Gold prices are expected to continue their bullish trend, driven by expectations of a Federal Reserve interest rate cut and weak US labor market data. Political instability and central bank demand are also supporting the price. While overbought conditions suggest caution, analysts anticipate a potential rise to $3720-$3750 per ounce in the coming weeks.

title: Delhi: Fire breaks out at Pizza hut in Yamuna Vihar; 5 sustain burn injuries
content: A fire erupted outside a Pizza Hut in Yamuna Vihar, northeast Delhi, on Monday night, resulting in minor burn injuries to five individuals. The incident, triggered by a short circuit near an electricity meter, led to a small LPG cylinder explosion.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,950; Sensex up over 300 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday on positive sentiment around India-US trade deal talks. While Nifty50 was near the 25,000 mark, BSE Sensex was up over 300 points.

title: Canada rejects 80% of Indian student visas in 2025, Germany rises as top destination
content: In 2025, Canada implemented its most restrictive student visa regime in a decade, rejecting nearly 80% of Indian applications and tightening financial and language requirements. This has caused a sharp decline in Indian enrolments, forcing students to consider alternatives like Germany, which now leads in popularity. The shift signals a global recalibration in international student mobility and education trends.

title: Megan Thee Stallion vs Adin Ross: Rapper sues streamer; what we know
content: Rapper Megan Thee Stallion has sued streamer Adin Ross. The lawsuit is regarding Ross's comments on the Tory Lanez shooting incident. Stallion's legal team accuses Ross of spreading misinformation. Ross confirmed he was served legal papers in an unusual way. A mariachi band appeared at his home to deliver the deposition.

title: 'One-size-fits-all' won't work: Gavaskar questions Bronco test as India selection tool
content: Sunil Gavaskar has cautioned the BCCI against using the Bronco fitness test as the sole criterion for national team selection. He emphasized that fitness requirements vary significantly across different player roles, such as wicketkeepers, fast bowlers, spinners, and batters.

title: '100% tariff': US official says Trump proposed higher duties on Russian oil buyers India, China
content: US reportedly considers increased tariffs on nations buying Russian oil, including India. Donald Trump suggests tariffs of 50-100% on buyers like China and India. Trump wants the EU to act alongside the US. Discussions involved US and EU officials, plus Ukraine's prime minister. This comes as Trump said he looked forward to speaking with PM Narendra Modi soon to resolve trade barriers.

title: Shreyas Iyer's shocking revelation: 'I was paralysed, nerve snapped, rod in my back'
content: Shreyas Iyer disclosed a career-threatening back injury that led to paralysis in one leg and his subsequent omission from the BCCI's central contract list. Despite enduring excruciating pain and a year-long recovery after surgery, Iyer remains determined to regain his place in the Indian squad.

title: Phillies fan snatches kid‚Äôs HR ball: Controversy takes twist; 'Karen' offered $5k
content: A Phillies fan's disputed home run ball incident continues to unfold, with a trading card company offering $5,000 for its return to a young fan. The catch? The woman involved must inscribe it with an apology. This saga follows a tense stadium confrontation and subsequent support from the Phillies, Marlins, and others for the birthday boy, Lincoln Feltwell.

title: ED arrests Karnataka Congress MLA Satish Sail; 6.7kg gold seized
content: Congress MLA Satish Krishna Sail from Karwar was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday in connection with the 2010 illegal iron ore export case involving Rs 86 crore. Following raids across multiple locations, the ED seized Rs 1.4 crore from Sail's residence, Rs 27 lakh from Sri Lal Mahal offices, and 6.

title: On Camera, Man Bleeds, Pleads To Be Spared During Assault In Tamil Nadu
content: The Cuddalore district police in Tamil Nadu opened fire and arrested three drunken men who allegedly went on a violent rampage, brutally attacking six people, including two police personnel.

title: Fitch Raises India's Growth Forecast To 6.9% From 6.5% This Fiscal
content: Fitch Ratings has raised its forecast for India's economic growth for the current fiscal year to 6.9% from 6.5% earlier, citing stronger-than-expected momentum in the June quarter driven by robust services activity and resilient consumption.

title: 82% Indians Opted For e-Visa In 2025, These Nations Were Top Destinations
content: Electronic visa (e-visas) accounted for 82 per cent of all visa applications in India in 2025, up from 79 per cent in 2024, according to a report on Wednesday.

title: "Karisma's Children Already Got 1,900 Crore": Sunjay Kapur's Wife In Court
content: The high-stakes battle over late industrialist Sunjay Kapur's approximately Rs 30,000 crore estate played out in a courtroom on Wednesday after his wife Priya Kapur challenged her step-daughters' plea seeking share in his personal assets.

title: India-Nepal Border On High Alert, Restrictions On Who May Cross Over
content: India has tightened security along its border with Nepal amid violent, youth-led protests against a social media ban and corruption in the neighbouring Himalayan country, where Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli has resigned under public pressure.

title: Ashok Raj Sigdel: Nepal Army Chief And Key Crisis Leader
content: Nepal Army Chief General Ashok Raj Sigdel has urged citizens to remain calm and protect public and private property as the country remains in the throes of a political crisis.

title: Delhi High Court Seeks List Of Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 Crore Assets
content: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday issued notice in a civil suit filed by Bollywood actor Karisma Kapoor's two children, who are seeking a share in the Rs 30,000 crore estate of their late father, industrialist Sunjay Kapur.

title: What's Behind Nepal's Protests: Economic Woes, Corruption, Digital Crackdown
content: Nepali youth, digitally savvy but bowed down by unemployment and limited opportunities, hit a breaking point this week, furious at an elderly ruling class they see as out of touch.

title: Delhi Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa Gives Punjabi Twist To GST
content: When asked to give a full form of GST in Punjabi, Mr Sirsa said, "Pehli baat toh GST Punjabi mein koi dena kyu chahega?"(First of all, why would anyone give GST in Punjabi?)

title: She Wanted To Crush Lemon With Thar, SUV Flew Out Of Showroom's 1st Floor
content: Maani Pawar wanted to perform a customary ritual inside the Mahindra showroom - squeezing a lemon under the car's tyre - before driving her new Thar out on the road.

title: 14 Governments Since 2008: A Timeline Of Political Instability In Nepal
content: Nepal's Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday amid violent nationwide anti-corruption protests, plunging the country into fresh political uncertainty.

title: Rs 31 Lakh Gone In 8 Days: How Ex-Karnataka MLA Got Conned By Fake Judge
content: Former Karnataka MLA Gundappa Vakil was conned of Rs 31 lakh by men pretending to be CBI officer, Deputy Commissioner of Police and judge. Mr Vakil was put under digital arrest for a week.

title: "Special Thanks To..": Kiren Rijiju On Possible Cross-Voting In Veep Poll
content: Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday took a "conscience" swipe at the opposition over the probability of cross-voting by the INDIA bloc MPs in the recently concluded Vice Presidential election.

title: From Minister To Target In 4 Days: Before-After Pics Capture Nepal Horror
content: On September 4, Dr Arzu Rana Deuba, then Nepal's Foreign Affairs Minister, unveiled two aircraft provided by the US government at a ceremony at Tribhuvan International Airport. Four days later, the 63-year-old minister was praying for her life

title: US Alert On Israeli Strikes Baseless, Warning Came Amid Explosions: Qatar
content: President Donald Trump was trying to walk a delicate line following Israel's attack on Hamas officials in Qatar, saying he's "not thrilled" about the strike Tuesday while stopping short for now of condemning Israel for carrying out the strike

title: "Ticked It Off My Bucket List": Artist Abhay Sehgal Shares Emotional Video Of Returning To School As Chief Guest
content: Visiting your school after years feels surreal and even more so when you are invited as chief guest. That's exactly what happened to Delhi-based artist Abhay Sehgal, who returned to St George's College, Mussoorie, a decade after graduating.

title: "India's Keyboard Minions": Trump Aide After Tariff Claim Fact-Checked On X
content: Even as India and the United States decided to resume their trade talk, President Donald Trump's trade adviser, Peter Navarro, continued his rant over New Delhi's purchase of Russian oil.

title: Nepal Protest Live Updates: Nepal Army Warns Mob Amid Curfew, Talks Scheduled With Protestors
content: Nepal Protest Live Updates: In Nepal, demonstrations against the short-lived social media ban and corruption¬†grew increasingly violent on Tuesday, with protesters setting¬†government buildings and politicians‚Äô homes on fire.

title: "DMK Should Not Come Back To Power": Nirmala Sitharaman On AIADMK Tie-Up
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman today said that the NDA alliance in Tamil Nadu is united for one goal: "DMK should not come back to power in 2026".

title: Nearly Two-Thirds of US Firms In China See Revenue Dip From Tariffs: Survey
content: Many US companies operating in China expect their sales to take a hit this year from US President Donald Trump's tariffs and the ones that China has imposed in response, as per an annual survey released by the American Chamber of Commerce

title: NFL says Carter's ejection serves as suspension
content: the Philadelphia Eagles star will not miss any future games for spitting on quarterback dak Prescott . the league would consider the second-year defensive tackle to have served a one-game suspension . this is an important distinction by the NFL, which establishes a precedent . he will forfeit his week 1 game check worth $57,222 .

title: Week 2 Power Rankings: Stacking the teams, plus top newcomer performances
content: the Minnesota Vikings beat the Chicago Bears on "Monday Night Football" the Packers finished their opening week of the 2025 season with a comeback win . the Pittsburgh Steelers, the Green Bay Packers and the Buffalo Bills topped their power rankings .

title: What to know about all 32 playcallers in the NFL: We have key trends to watch for every team
content: the 2025 season is underway, which means we got our first look at new playcallers such as the Detroit Lions ' John Morton, Tampa Bay Buccaneers ' Josh Grizzard and the Super Bowl champion Philadelphia Eagles' each of them will carry the dual responsibility of coaching and calling offensive plays .

title: What makes a baseball player exciting? We asked two rising MLB stars
content: a baseball player bracket skews young, with the average age (26.4) more than two years younger than the MLB average (28.6) . the bracket embodies several common qualities among our 32 entrants . "i just like seeing guys who can do a lot of different things on the field," says a representative .

title: 49ers put tight end Kittle on IR, cut kicker Moody
content: the 49ers placed tight end George Kittle on injured reserve with a hamstring injury . the last of those games is set for "Thursday Night Football" the earliest Kittle could return would be for the Oct. 12 game at the Tampa Bay Buccaneers .

title: Fantasy reaction: Bigsby trade a boon to Etienne's fantasy value
content: the fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . a big spike in Jacory Croskey-Merritt's start rate after his nice performance in Week 1 . Travis Etienne Jr. is the biggest winner here after leading the team .
